c74object.name: the.bfg~
c74object.digest: Host and populate a buffer with procedural content (GPU) as wavetable
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze Â© 2023, www.xenorama.com.
Create a named buffer as a procedural wavetable populated by any function shader available to the internal jit.gl.bfg object. The waveform can be dynamically animated, limited to the maximum framerate with optional smoothing and interpolation. Driven by signal or MIDI Notes the.bfg~ can serve as instant monophonic synthesizer.
By default, the waveform is self-windowed. All GPU-generated functions have to be translated to the CPU upon every frame to be available to MSP.

objarg.name: buffer-name
objarg.digest: Number of samples to ramp up absolute signal value
objarg.description: INumber of samples to ramp up absolute signal value, equivalent to an envelope attack. The default is 1 sample.

objarg.name: initial-frequency
objarg.digest: Set the frequency of the wavetable
objarg.description: Set the frequency of the wavetable when provided as float, and MIDI note when provided as int. This argument require the audio listing to be flagged.

attribute.name: amp_mod
attribute.description:
Mix waveform with trigonometrical functions. This settings requires 4 arguments:
function-name: (symbol) sin/sine, triangle/tri, saw//linear or rect/square
periods: (float) frequency of the function
amp-mode: (0-4)
0 = "none",
1 = "function + scaled modulator",
2 = "blend"
3 = "modulator + scaled function",
4 = "modulator * function" (default)
amount: (0.-1.) amount of amplitude modulation

attribute.name: animate
attribute.digest: Change the time property of the function per frame
attribute.description:
Change the time property of the function per frame. The float number provided will increment the internal function's time by the given amount per frame.
To avoid unwanted artefacts it is advised to keep this setting between 0.-1. which scales time increments between 0.-0.01.

attribute.name: audio
attribute.digest: Enable the internal audio engine for direct playback
attribute.description: Enable the internal audio engine for direct playback. This setting is by default off (0).

attribute.name: dcblock
attribute.digest: Filter digital components in audio output
attribute.description:
Filter digital components in audio output. Since the internal buffer~ may get populated by amplitude ranges below or above zero due to the offset of the internal jit.gl.bfg, activating dcblock will normalize the waveform output to even amplitude ranges.
This setting is on by default (1).

attribute.name: dim
attribute.digest: Resolution of the internal function texture
attribute.description:
Resolution of the internal function texture. By default, the internal texture has the dimension 256 1 and can be adapted using this setting.
Note, that this does not change the size of the buffer, which is handled by the samps listing.

attribute.name: interval
attribute.digest: Set the frame interval of the internal jit.gl.render
attribute.description: Set the maximum frame interval of the internal jit.gl.render object. When provided as floating-point number, will be interpreted as miliseconds, when appened by "fps", "samples" or "ms" will be translated to miliseconds.

attribute.name: interp
attribute.digest: Interpolate sample values in the internal jit_matrix
attribute.description: Interpolate sample values in the internal jit_matrix. This setting is by default on (1).

attribute.name: samps
attribute.digest: Size in samples of the named buffer~
attribute.description: Size in samples of the named buffer~. The default is 2048 samples.

attribute.name: sendbfg
attribute.digest: Send any message to the internal jit.gl.bfg~
attribute.description: Send any valid message to the internal jit.gl.bfg~ object. Note, that all keys contained in the dictionary sent from the dump outlet can be addressed directly without the messagename "sendbfg".

attribute.name: sendbuf
attribute.digest: Send any message to the internal buffer~
attribute.description: Send any valid message to the internal buffer~ object. Note, that the samps listing can be addressed directly without the messagename "sendbuf".

attribute.name: slide
attribute.digest: Smoothe values of the internal jit_matrix
attribute.description:
Smoothe values of the internal jit_matrix before populating the buffer~. This affects the contents of the buffer~ while vec_smooth affects audio output only.
Note also that this setting is ignored when the content is not animated.

attribute.name: window
attribute.description: Set the linear windowing range. A value of 0 applies no windowing, a value of 1 applies maximum windowing (across half the function)

attribute.name: vec_smooth
attribute.description:
Vector-based amplitude smoothing. Increase this setting, either as floating point value or as list consisting of a smoothing option and a floating point number, to achieve amplitude smoothing on the signal output of all the buffer's vectors during quick manipulation to avoid clicks.
Available smoothing algorithms are "rampsmooth" (default), "slide" and "deltaclip"
See the vectral~ object for more details.

method.name: bang
method.description: Update the wavetable and output dictionary

method.name: dictionary
method.digest:
Set the internal jit.gl.bfg attributes.
Currently this will throw a warning in the Max console when containing keys which are currently "not used in current shader state".
method.description: Update the wavetable and output dictionary

method.name: freq
method.digest: Set the frequency of the wavetable
method.description: Set the frequency of the wavetable. This requires the audio listing to be activated.

method.name: jit_gl_texture
method.digest: Transform the internal basis function graph
method.description: Transform the internal basis function graph when set to basis input.distorted or input.distorted.2axis

method.name: jit_matrix
method.description:
Replace buffer~ content. Any incoming jit_matrix will override the internal buffer~ content, interpolating matrix data as per the interp setting to the samples defined by samps and reading only plane 0.
Note that during animation this message is ignored.

method.name: note
method.digest: Set the frequency of the wavetable as MIDI note
method.description: Set the frequency of the wavetable as MIDI note. This requires the audio listing to be activated.

method.name: signal
method.digest: Set the frequency of the wavetable
method.description: Set the frequency of the wavetable. This requires the audio listing to be activated.
